PAD_PushedByRing.synopsis: Player reacts to being pushed by the rings in the crypt of the Shar temple.
PAD_PushedByRing.how_to_trigger: 1. loadLevel SCL_Main_A2. goto -717 5 -8623. Run into one of the triggers.

AD_Mirrors.synopsis: Narrator AD on smaller mirrors in SHA temple. Player can mention there is something magical about them, instead of just reflection of surrounding world. There are couple of them in the temple

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Based on the provided descriptions and triggers, we can infer a loose narrative progression in the crypt/temple area. The plaque at the entrance (PAD_PuzzlePlaque) is encountered first. Once inside, the player sees a statue, which causes a reaction (PAD_StatueReaction). Soon after, the player comes upon the taunting skull (AD_MagicSkull), whose warning seems to set the stage for further crypt challenges. The door with the magic lock (PAD_MagicLockedDoor) is then encountered – note its description explicitly states it happens before the puzzle is solved – and as the player continues further into the crypt, they trigger being pushed by rings (PAD_PushedByRing), which then leads to additional environmental narration (AD_Mirrors). In addition, there appear to be two sessions related to the statue – one where the player merely reacts (PAD_StatueReaction) and another (PAD_StatueTalksReaction) that might occur if the statue were to speak. Since these two represent different outcomes from the same interaction, they are mutually exclusive. Other sessions such as PAD_Welcomed and AD_CandlestickCountdown have insufficient ordering data to place them in the chain of events, so they are omitted from the ordering constraints.
